intro: Tetradium amarissimum, commonly known as the bitter tetracarp, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers and smooth, aromatic bark. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain four seeds, giving it its scientific name. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in lowland forests and along stream banks. The bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported medicinal properties.
